display: I've got the app running at localhost:1200. I want you to add some example data. Please create 12 fake workers and 7 HealthCareFacility then create historic shifts for each worker. Some workers only work at one facility. Some work at up to 3. All facilities have at least 5 shifts
Great. Now read the brief in README.md and execute
Stay on this branch to execute on the brief yourself. Make the changes in the files you would like to see in the PR
Start it on another port `PORT=1200 npm start`
Since a shift can have multiple ShiftAssignments (as many as the workerSlots) rating needs to be on ShiftAssignment so that the rating includes the person who worked the shift. Can you update this?
ok, now knowing everything you do about this project. checkout the v0-1-add-worker-rating branch and review the PR
What is the current pattern to return errors?
If it doesn't exist in the repo then just say "this repo does not handle errors
I want to install the package manager uv for python. Can you check to make sure that python is installed correctly? I think python3 works, but `which python` isn't finding anything

I have the obsidian rest api plugin setup and running. My api key is a3ffbaac1e50237f86c0759703df8f40df355b440d56c0bc137cb533b3fd835c

Help me setup mcp-server using the readme in this repo
Add this mcp to claude code
what transport type and url is the mcp server running on?
I have an mcp server setup in `~/.claude.json` thats not showing up in this version of claude. Can you help me debug?
What obsidian notes do I have?
What notes do I have in my obsidian vault?

I want you to use the mcp-obsidian mcp tools to help move my job search notes from this notion export into Obsidian. I want to improve the organization of my job search using the bases feature of Obsidian. Read more about it here https://help.obsidian.md/bases

For each job application I want to be able to track
- Status: Proposed, Targeting, Applied, Phone Screen, Interview, Offer, Rejected
- When applications moved to different statuses
- I want write thoughts each time I interact with the companies
- The company applied to
- Date applied
- job posting url
- Include submission materials that may be in PDF or other formats

These look generally great! but there's a problem with the base. When I try to view the dashboard it says

Unable to parse your base file:

Implicit keys need to be on a single line at line 1, column 1: ```base ^

The base file is not working correctly Job Search Dashboard.base

It says there are multiple documents? Please make sure this is in correct yaml format
This is still incorrect. Read https://help.obsidian.md/bases/syntax and fix the syntax

This base file is not good. You need to rewrite it from scratch. Use the pdf I'm including as your documentation. Consult all the items in Job Applications to understand what you need to do

/Users/adam.trimble/Desktop/Bases\ syntax\ -\ Obsidian\ Help.pdf

This base file is not good. You need to rewrite it from scratch. Use the pdf I'm including as your documentation. Consult all the items in Job Applications to understand what you need to do

/Users/adam.trimble/Desktop/Bases\ syntax\ -\ Obsidian\ Help.pdf

@"Job Search Dashboard.base" is not good. It needs to be rewritten using the correct syntax. It should be a base for all the items in Job Descriptions folder. Use the syntax instructions I paste below

My settings for claude code are in ~/.claude right now. I want them to be in this repository so I can commit them and move them from computer to computer
insertFullPath should be selection aware and if lines are highlighted it should indicate which lines
How should another microservice call sneakers to understand if a user is an account manager. If they are an account manager it should return the accounts that user manages

Lets do option two. To do that we'll need to start with creating the protos PR. This defines the grpc endpoint for other microservices. You can see an example of that at ../sneakers/flash_sale/admin/api/v1/server.proto which corresponds to app/grpc/admin_flash_sale_service.rb
